dialog:
Draven lets out a boisterous chuckle,

'Now that's a good lad. All troubles and still trying to lend a hand. I'll tell ye what boy, take these nails, fix that fence, and come next spring we can work on the roof. She needs new timbers and I ain't gonna be able to get them till spring. She'll last another winters snow by the Ancestors!'

Draven hands you the nails and wishes you a good day.
